event.title: reopened the venue as a live-music hall in 1996

data.event: Robertson and her father, Albert H. Shulman, reopened the venue as a live-music hall in 1996, and it has hosted hundreds of concerts since, from to Gillian Welch, along with shows by the Flaming Lips, Queens of the Stone Age and many more.

event.title: think one of my favorite, favorite concerts was the two nights

data.event: "I think one of my favorite, favorite concerts was the two nights we had of Godsmack" in 1999, Robertson said, recalling singer Sully Erna as "one of the nicest people I could run into."
"I think one of my favorite, favorite concerts was the two nights we had of Godsmack" in 1999, Robertson said, recalling singer Sully Erna as "one of the nicest people I could run into."
Shulman died in 2003, and Robertson bought out her siblings to continue running the Webster.
Tragedy struck the Webster last year, when booker Ben Wu disappeared while on the island of Tortola to attend the wedding of Robertson's daughter, Stephanie Decker.
